channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024091126
item.description:
Report X-2024091126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 9/13/2024 at approximately 2330, Dnagerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 220288 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 30 small cans of paint packaged in a fiberboard box. One of the can had a loose top, resulting in spillage. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2024090376
item.description:
Report E-2024090376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-26
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1837 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at NKX. It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of UN2491 Pre Tect 7080 HP released from 330-gallon metal tote. The valve at the top of the tote was broken off and is missing. The release impacted the floor of trailer #3110252 and the concrete underneath at Dock Door 78. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site, neutralized the area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned up the released material from 2'x23' trailer and 2'x10 concrete with impacted acid pads and Sodium Baicarb. Product was transloaded to new metal tote. Damaged tote and drum were staged onsite at the terminal for personnel to manage.
